section.desc: The beloved childrens' television channel loves to build toys and games. In this project, they asked for a site where very young kids could build holiday cards for their family. It needed to be skinnable for several holidays and extremely simple to use (no draging). Using this framework, we were able to generate a new holiday site in about an hour of development time.
section.title: Sprout Card Creator

section.desc:
Winner of a Gold Addy in 2009, this site was a partnering with Nokia and Verizon Wireless to launch a branded cellphone for the release of The Dark Knight. The microsite incroporates 3D and video, sophisticated video-tracking viral experience, mobile game, and branded content.

I was the lead developer on this project over a team of four others.
section.title: Batman: The Dark Knight

section.desc:
This project was a Hulu-style video on demand website for Rogers, the Canadian TelCom. I primarily built the Flash video player, but also worked on other areas of the site, including the homepage A-spot.

The live website is geo-restricted to Canada.
section.title: Rogers On Demand

section.desc: The Verizon Wireless cellphone rich landing pages were ovehauled in 2007 with this microsite. The framework I built was based upon extensive user testing and designed for easy skinning and customization. As a testament to its success, this template was used for three years and over fifty iterations before its redesign.
section.title: LG Voyager Microsite

section.desc: The FiOS TV HD microsite was launched with the 2008 announcement of the new service. The microsite was designed for longevity and based off of a number of independent modules that could be swapped easily by designers or developers without worrying about code conflicts.
